text: hi guys! good morning!
Any advice on some add-on to use to see tests coverage in an ember-cli app?
Also, do you have some good settings for the js linter?
Morning <@U0A48LWTG>
I haven’t used it personally but <https://emberobserver.com/addons/ember-cli-blanket> scores well and has a cute name
and <https://emberobserver.com/addons/ember-cli-eslint> must be worth a look since it’s maintained by Robert Jackson
thank you <@U03V8V08M> :slightly_smiling_face:
will be interested to hear how blanket works out for you
<@U03V8V08M>: sure, if we decide to go with it I’ll let you know!
does anyone know how to output a `console.log` when running your test suite with phantomJS
I’m having one of those amazing failures that happen in phantom and not chrome
failing with phantomjs `1.9.8` and `2.1.1`
<@U047GTU64>: have you tried with remote debugging? :slightly_smiling_face: <http://phantomjs.org/troubleshooting.html#remote-debugging>
<@U07E9GKUZ>: nope, lets try that :sun_with_face:
you can console.log too, but sticking a debugger is much better usually
how do you pass that option to the `ember test` ?
you can add things in the testem config
"phantomjs_debug_port": 9000
<@U09ABGTUJ>: thanks!
np :slightly_smiling_face:
I’m on `<http://127.0.0.1:9000/webkit/inspector/inspector.html>` visiting the console tab
